review_title: Great charity with big impact, interesting roles and effective management and leadership
pros:
A committed team of friendly, interesting and smart people who are dedicated to making a difference. 
Really supportive and engaged management and leadership, who give praise and encouragement. Just nice people to work with and feel you're making a difference. 
Fantastic opportunities to learn new skills and experience, great for career development that wouldn't be available at lots of similar charities. 
No HR department means that the management team has an eye on the staff and is receptive to any needs. 'Open Door' policy for staff. 
Good benefits - pensions, health insurance, really good holiday entitlement, contribution to bicycle purchase, flexible working.
cons: It's always busy - more experienced staff to support the goals would be good.
The Directors (a married couple) are controlling and poorly managing this organisation. Google “founder’s syndrome” before you apply because this will be your bread and butter.
